triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio is significantly above the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to unsustainable affordability metrics.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum DTI for Tier C applicants is 35%. The applicant's DTI ratio of 11000% is far beyond this limit, indicating severe affordability issues.

triageFlags.title: Credit Score Below Minimum Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score is below the minimum required for financing.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to insufficient creditworthiness.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a minimum credit score of 620 for Tier C applicants. A score of 575 places the applicant in a high-risk category, making them ineligible for financing.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier, and their credit score falls below the minimum required for financing. These factors indicate a high risk of default.
